question: How can I make a sourdough starter from scratch and generate an image of a freshly baked sourdough loaf?

steps.content: How can I make a sourdough starter from scratch and generate an image of a freshly baked sourdough loaf?
Plan: 1) Search for instructions on making a sourdough starter from scratch. 2) Generate an image of a freshly baked sourdough loaf. 3) Return the answer.
Searching for instructions on making a sourdough starter from scratch.
To make a sourdough starter: Day 1: Mix 1 cup whole wheat flour with 1/2 cup water. Day 2-5: Discard half and feed with 1 cup all-purpose flour and 1/2 cup water daily.
Generating an image of a freshly baked sourdough loaf.
Image of a freshly baked sourdough loaf generated.
What is the best temperature to keep the starter at during fermentation?
Plan: 1) Search for the best temperature to keep a sourdough starter during fermentation. 2) Return the answer.
Searching for the best temperature to keep a sourdough starter during fermentation.
The best temperature to keep a sourdough starter during fermentation is between 70°F and 75°F (21°C and 24°C).

To make a sourdough starter: Day 1: Mix 1 cup whole wheat flour with 1/2 cup water. Day 2-5: Discard half and feed with 1 cup all-purpose flour and 1/2 cup water daily. Image of a freshly baked sourdough loaf generated. The best temperature to keep the starter during fermentation is between 70°F and 75°F (21°C and 24°C).
